Description: Rounded base and globular body of a small glass flask, , broken at the base of the neck, neck and rim not preserved. Free-blown. Original colour cannot be determined as glass is completely corroded, now covered by layer of iridescence (violet-bluish).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From Naukratis. 1886-7: excavated by William Matthew Flinders Petrie for the Egypt Exploration Fund, assigned to the EEF by the Egyptian government; December 22, 1887, presented to the MFA by the EEF. (Accession date: 1888).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FE.16)
